text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantino here Internet's busiest
music nerd like my new curtain pretty
depressing basically I hope you don't
mind me doing a short little review over
here of the new pharmacon album
abandoned pharmacon is the experimental
music project of Margaret whose last
name I imagine is pronounced char da if
her last name is as French as I imagined
it to be she's been involved with the
fringe side of music since she was about
17 and this new LP of her seems to be
her first kind of big commercial
full-length effort it's out now on
sacred bones records now considering the
genres that Margaret toys with on this
record noise music little bit of ambient
music power electronics some people will
say I'm actually surprised that she
doesn't have more music in her
discography I'm talking like hundreds
upon hundreds of just home recorded CD
ours and cassettes of semi-improvised
noise pieces but actually that's not the
case in fact her discography is is
somewhat sparse and from why I read
about her she doesn't really improvise
her pieces whatsoever
they're all very methodical they're all
very planned out they have clear
cohesive patterns to them and for sure
abandon is an album though it is noisy
it is pretty organized it is pretty
detailed though still very over-the-top
as you can imagine with plenty of
blood-curdling shrieks coming out of
Margaret's mouth on some of these tracks
especially the opener on here which
which really to me feels like Margaret's
mouth is just Pandora's box she just
opens it and pretty much every sound you
can imagine being in hell comes out it's
a no surprise to me that she describes
her music in a way to be kind of an
exorcism for sure it feels that way now
as far as lyrical content what she is
saying if in fact she is saying anything
is is pretty into sight
durable though that doesn't necessarily
ruin the tracks for me really her vocals
are just for added sound added effect if
you will as far as other sounds on this
album Margaret is is pretty great when
it comes to sound craft whether it be
some very murky vocals that might be
performed live might be pretty recorded
and kind of looped and layered on top of
one another to make this kind of
psychedelic theory wall of vocals which
happens on the second half of the track
ache it's a really dreary atmosphere
this creates or whether it be just very
droning sharp high-pitched ear piercing
electronics like on the track pitted and
of course on top of these very sharp
electronics Margaret is bringing these
vocals that are just very stony
very cold very deadpan the song is
backed up with this industrially
flavored Bank Lang percussion and the
drone at the end of this track gets so
sharp it gets so sharp as the song
finishes it's like dentist drills going
straight into my skull even though this
album can be pretty abrasive at times it
is somewhat hypnotic and kind of
alluring with its eeriness its ominous
'no sand it's it's repetition one of the
tracks on here crawling on bruised knees
might be my favorite on this album for
one there are these repetitious samples
happening throughout the track that
feels like margaret was pointing a
microphone at a low-flying plane it does
effectively create a very weird vibe for
this tune I like the very minimal
repetitive beat on this track the very
treated vocals it's like a robot just
screaming for the end of its life
suffering and pain or something the
issue for me with this track and many
other tracks really just this album as a
whole is that there is ear grabbing
sound play and ferocity throughout this
thing but the songs and the sounds and
ideas really lose their luster over
these six or seven minute song lengths
that really don't feature that much
progression in my opinion a lot of the
tracks on here just close out with me
feeling
they didn't really do much outside of
just repeat the original idea that it
introduced which which of course was
interesting when it was first introduced
but by the time the album is over the
song is over rather I'm just on the
fence the songs on your only end up to
me being memorable for their elements
not really how they assembled them and
of course the very disjointed 27 minute
long closing track on here which I
suspect was kind of added as an album
only track on the high tunes to get
people to buy the whole LP as opposed to
just a few songs off of it that track
really just didn't do anything for me
and sort of epitomizes my issue with
this album at times it's that it can be
intense but the intensity doesn't really
progress or go much of anywhere a lot of
ideas on here are pretty good but very
disjointed and don't build on one
another really for sure I'm looking
forward to future music coming out of
this project there is a lot of potential
here I think Margaret like I said is
great when it comes to intensity and
when it comes to mood and when it comes
to sounds it's just building these songs
out to something that feels engaging for
six or seven minutes that I think needs
to to happen Plus that there's just a
handful of songs on this LP just four
tracks outside with a very long closing
track of course on a future pharmacon
release I would want to see some more
material as well
yeah I'm just sort of on the fence with
this LP if you've given them to listen
what did you think of it love it hate it
why and that's it pharmacon anthony
Fantana
you
